entry.title: Ledger Launches Web3 Game Cometh Battle via Live App
entry.summary: Known for its popular hardware wallets, Ledger is now adding its first blockchain game to the Ledger Live software app.

entry.title: FTX Restructuring Team Has Clawed Back $5B in Lost Assets
entry.summary: FTX has also identified more than 9 million customer accounts linked to roughly $120 billion associated transactions.

entry.title: Crypto Twitter Reacts to Official 'Game of Thrones' NFTs: 'Worst Thing I've Ever Seen'
entry.summary: The highly-anticipated Game of Thrones’ NFT launch is already sold out despite delays and critics saying it lacked “creative vision.”

entry.title: Gold Fever Is Evolving Blockchain Gaming Beyond Play-To-Earn
entry.summary: The multiplayer jungle survival strategy game is inspired by a real-life gold rush—and puts gameplay first.

entry.title: Gemini Officially Terminates Crypto Earn Program Amid DCG, Genesis Spat
entry.summary: The Winklevoss-owned crypto exchange Gemini said returning customer assets remained its “highest priority.”

entry.title: Dutch Bitcoin Exchange Bitvavo Says DCG’s Payback Plan ‘Not Acceptable’
entry.summary: The Netherlands’ biggest crypto exchange Bitvavo insists on full repayment of the $297 million it is owed by Genesis Trading.

entry.title: Cathie Wood’s Ark Invest Boosts Coinbase Holdings by Another $1.45M
entry.summary: Despite tough times for Coinbase, Ark Invest's $1.45 million COIN purchase yesterday makes it the firm's eleventh buy in less than a month.

entry.title: Court Grants Voyager Initial Approval for $1B Binance US Deal
entry.summary: The deal, which will see the Voyager users get roughly half their assets back, still needs to pass another court hearing to become final.

entry.title: FTX's Next Bankruptcy Hearing: Deadlines, Leases, and SBF's Attorneys Step Forward
entry.summary: There has been a flurry of filings leading up to Wednesday’s hearing, including a motion to admit attorneys representing Sam Bankman-Fried.

entry.title: Bankruptcy Filing Reveals Tom Brady, Kevin O’Leary, and Coinbase Among Major FTX Creditors
entry.summary: Bankruptcy attorneys released a long list of names and the number of shares held by former associates and investors.

entry.title: Crypto’s Foot Fetish? Pixelated Feetpix NFTs Surge
entry.summary: The project topped OpenSea charts on Tuesday, prompting some Twitter users to declare the return of “degen season.”

entry.title: FTX Had an Office Across the Street From the White House
entry.summary: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX is currently trying to get out of a six-year lease it signed for WeWork office space in D.C., right across the street from 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.

entry.title: BONK NFTs Boom—But Solana-Based Meme Token Is Down 69% Since Peak
entry.summary: After selling out, the BONKz NFTs are now trading for 10 times the mint price—but the actual BONK token is still sliding.

entry.title: Binance Admits to Problems With Its BUSD Peg
entry.summary: Analysts reveal the crypto exchange undercollateralized its holdings by at least $1 billion, and not just once.

entry.title: The Hopes and Horrors of the Metaverse Were in Focus at CES 2023
entry.summary: Web3 developments were out in force at the conference, as exhibitors attempted to lure conference attendees into the metaverse.

entry.title: DCG Bites Back at Winklevoss as Barry Silbert Distances Company From FTX and SBF
entry.summary: A dispute between Digital Currency Group and Gemini over locked user funds continues to escalate.

entry.title: Twitter Developing ‘Coins’ Feature With Stripe Payments
entry.summary: The new feature will allow users to reward individual tweets with “Awards” using “Coins,” which can be withdrawn at a $50 minimum threshold.

entry.title: Crypto.com Will Delist Tether in Canada to Comply With Ontario Regulator
entry.summary: The exchange said it will no longer facilitate transactions associated with the stablecoin at the end of the month.

entry.title: Former Coinbase Manager's Brother Gets 10-Month Sentence for Insider Trading
entry.summary: Nikhil Wahi, brother of former Coinbase product manager Ishan Wahi, pleaded guilty in September.

entry.title: Winklevoss Demands DCG CEO Barry Silbert Step Down, Alleges Accounting Fraud
entry.summary: Gemini's Cameron Winklevoss lanced multiple serious allegations at the crypto conglomerate, including misrepresentation and accounting fraud.

entry.title: Law Firm Investigating Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific for Alleged Securities Fraud
entry.summary: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific is being investigated by Pomerantz LLP over alleged securities fraud "or other unlawful business practices."

entry.title: Edward Snowden Pentagon Papers NFT to Be Auctioned Via Live PleasrDAO Show
entry.summary: The first interactive show on Thursday will feature a 1:1 Ethereum NFT auctioned in collaboration with Daniel Ellsberg.

entry.title: Mark Cuban Will Be Deposed for Promoting Bankrupt Crypto Lender Voyager
entry.summary: Cuban’s request to have his deposition in a recent lawsuit against Voyager split into two sessions was denied by court order yesterday.

entry.title: Coinbase Announces Further Layoffs, Cutting Headcount by 950 Employees
entry.summary: After first announcing layoffs last summer, crypto exchange Coinbase is continuing to trim its workforce—this time by 950 employees.

entry.title: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust Shares Jump 12%, Narrowing Discount
entry.summary: The discount for Grayscale's Bitcoin product hit its lowest value since mid-November, despite investor discontent and legal troubles.

entry.title: Former FTX Exec Nishad Singh Seeking Cooperation Deal From Authorities: Report
entry.summary: Singh’s possible deal with authorities reportedly revolves around large donations FTX and SBF had made to various political campaigns.

entry.title: GALA Soars 140% Over the Week as Gaming, NFT Coins Rally
entry.summary: As NFT interest continues to grow, gaming and NFT-related coins, like GALA, are leading this week’s rally.

entry.title: What You Need to Know About the Federal Probe Into Binance
entry.summary: “Binance has shown its commitment to security and compliance,” says a company spokesperson.

entry.title: Apple’s Mixed-Reality Headset to Launch This Spring: Report
entry.summary: Is this Apple’s path to the metaverse? The Reality Pro headset, as it’s reportedly called, is expected to debut soon.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Lawsuit Against Bored Ape 'Troll' May Have Just Opened a Can of Worms
entry.summary: Leaders of the company behind the Bored Ape Yacht Club will have to be deposed by a vocal, controversial critic after a federal judge’s ruling Monday.

entry.title: Logan Paul Drops Threat to Sue Coffeezilla Over CryptoZoo Criticism
entry.summary: CryptoZoo developer Zach Kelling is mulling legal action against Logan, saying he "set me back years."

entry.title: CFTC Charges Mango Markets Hacker With Fraud
entry.summary: The latest action against Avraham Eisenberg follows similar charges filed by the Justice Department for the multi-million dollar hack of the Solana exchange.

entry.title: Trump NFT Mania Gets a Very Short Term as Sales Nearly Vanish
entry.summary: Sunday’s sales total was over 99% lower than December’s peak day as the short-lived bubble of demand has well and truly popped.

entry.title: Wealthy Investors Still Feel Glum About Crypto—But Not XRP
entry.summary: CoinShares released data which shows general outflows from crypto products the past week, though not with Ripple’s XRP.

entry.title: Dogecoin Hits 3-Week High as Wider Crypto Market Flips Green
entry.summary: The world’s most popular meme coin Dogecoin is among the best-performing cryptocurrencies in the past 24 hours.

entry.title: Bankrupt Voyager Locks Horns With Alameda as SEC Questions $1B Binance Deal
entry.summary: Both the SEC and Alameda Research, once a creditor one of Voyager’s creditors, have questioned the legal underpinnings of the proposed deal.

entry.title: Wyre Announces Withdrawal Limits as Crypto Firm Navigates Crypto Winter
entry.summary: Wyre users are now only able to withdraw 90% of their funds, with the firm adding that it's "exploring strategic options" amid the bear market.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Tokens Rally as Shanghai Upgrade Nears
entry.summary: Ethereum’s upcoming Shanghai upgrade, which lets users unstake their ETH, is likely fueling investors’ interest in liquid staking projects.

entry.title: Former FTX US President Promises to Share More Information ‘In Time’
entry.summary: Former crypto executive Brett Harrison vowed to provide additional information about the U.S. arm of the collapsed crypto exchange FTX.

entry.title: Solana, Cardano Both Up 21% Late Sunday, Setting Monthly Highs
entry.summary: Solana got a boost from BONK, jumping over 60% for the week.

entry.title: Walking the Red Carpet at The Crypties 2022
entry.summary: Sander on the Street is back! Decrypt's Sander Lutz walked the red carpet and accosted attendees as they arrived at the inaugural Crypties awards gala in December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, presented by Decrypt Studios.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Highlight Reel
entry.summary: In December 2022 at Art Basel in Miami, Decrypt Studios held the inaugural Crypties awards gala. With emcee Josh Ostrovsky ("The Fat Jewish") and presenters from a range of crypto projects, statuettes were awarded in nine categories. The evening was sponsored by Polygon, Filecoin Foundation, Lamina1, Async, BeetsDAO, The Gold Mask, Gem Set, Breakout, Anonymous, Infinite Objects, Ape Water, Decentralized Pictures, and Vault 721.

entry.title: gm: Zora Looks Beyond NFTs to DAO Creation
entry.summary: Zora sees itself as more than just an NFT marketplace; its next era is about helping people easily launch a DAO. Zora Co-founder Jacob Horne joined Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward to talk competition, the NFT speculative boom and bust, how Zora and Nouns are connected, and why Zora thinks DAOs are the future. Watch Episode 27 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.

entry.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto
entry.summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agency’s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Don’t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SEC’s thinking on crypto—straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
